metadata.title: CVE-2021-46960 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: cifs:Return correct error code from smb2_get_enc_key Avoid a warning if theerror percolates back up: [440700.376476] CIFS VFS: \\otters.example.comcrypt_message: Could not get encryption key [440700.386947] ------------[cut here ]------------ [440700.386948] err = 1 [440700.386977] WARNING:CPU: 11 PID: 2733 at/build/linux-hwe-5.4-p6lk6L/linux-hwe-5.4-5.4.0/lib/errseq.c:74errseq_set+0x5c/0x70 ... [440700.397304] CPU: 11 PID: 2733 Comm: tarTainted: G OE 5.4.0-70-generic #78~18.04.1-Ubuntu ... [440700.397334] CallTrace: [440700.397346] __filemap_set_wb_err+0x1a/0x70 [440700.397419]cifs_writepages+0x9c7/0xb30 [cifs] [440700.397426] do_writepages+0x4b/0xe0[440700.397444] __filemap_fdatawrite_range+0xcb/0x100 [440700.397455]filemap_write_and_wait+0x42/0xa0 [440700.397486] cifs_setattr+0x68b/0xf30[cifs] [440700.397493] notify_change+0x358/0x4a0 [440700.397500]utimes_common+0xe9/0x1c0 [440700.397510] do_utimes+0xc5/0x150[440700.397520] __x64_sys_utimensat+0x88/0xd0

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-kvm - 4.4.0-1135.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1172-aws - 4.4.0-1172.187
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1106-gcp - 4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1078-oracle - 4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-257.291').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.145').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1172.187').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
